questiontext.text: In general the square of a complex number is not necessarily a positive real number; it may not even be real at all. For example if \(z=-2+i\) then \[\qquad z^2=(-2+i)^2=4-4i+i^2=4-4i-1=3-4i.\] However, the product of a complex number with its conjugate is always a non-negative real number. If \(z=a+i b\) then \[\begin{aligned} zz^*&=(a+i b)(a-i b)\\ &=a^2-a(i b)+(i b)a-i^2b^2\\ &=a^2-i^2b^2\\ &=a^2+b^2\qquad \text{since}\ \ i^2=-1 \qquad\end{aligned}\] For example, if \(z=2+i\) then \[\qquad zz^*=(2+i)(2-i)=4+1=5.\]
